title: Ford F-150 Lightning
content:
{{Short description|Electric pickup truck developed by Ford Motor Company}} {{about|the battery electric vehicle}} {{Missing information|recent history since production began, including dealers selling at vastly higher prices, and Ford's announced intention to take all EV sales to direct sales, skipping the dealer intermediaries|date=June 2022}} {{Use American English|date=June 2021}} {{Use dmy dates|date=June 2021}} {{Infobox electric vehicle | name = Ford F-150 Lightning | image = 2023 Ford F-150 Lightning.jpg | caption = | manufacturer = [[Ford Motor Company|Ford]] | related = [[Ford F-Series (fourteenth generation)]] | assembly = United States: [[Dearborn, Michigan]] ([[Ford River Rouge Complex]]) | model_years = 2022–present | production = April 2022 – present{{cite web | url=https://finance.yahoo.com/news/ford-begins-production-of-the-f-150-lightning-100052545.html | title=Ford begins production of the electric F-150 Lightning }} | layout = [[Dual-motor, four-wheel-drive]] | class = [[Pickup truck|Full-size pickup truck]] | sp = us | battery = 98.0 or 131.0{{nbsp}}kWh{{cite magazine |last=Hoffman |first=Connor |date=17 December 2021|title=Ford Confirms 2022 F-150 Lightning EV Battery Specs |url=https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a38552140/2022-ford-f-150-lightning-battery-specs-revealed/ |magazine=Car and Driver |access-date=17 December 2021}} pouch-style [[Lithium-ion battery|Li-ion battery packs]] | motor = Dual [[permanent magnet motor]]s | electric_range = {{convert|230|mi|km|abbr=on}} (standard range)
{{convert|320|mi|km|abbr=on}} (extended range)
{{convert|300|mi|km|abbr=on}} (Platinum trim){{cite web |last1=Eisenstein |first1=Paul A. |title=Ford F-150 Lightning Beats Forecast — Delivers Up to 320 Miles Range|website=The Detroit Bureau |url=https://www.thedetroitbureau.com/2022/03/ford-f-150-lightning-beats-forecast-delivers-up-to-320-miles-range/ |access-date=21 March 2022 |date=21 March 2022}} | powerout = {{ubl | {{convert|452|hp|kW PS|0|abbr=on}} (standard battery) | {{convert|580|hp|kW PS|0|abbr=on}} (extended battery) }} | charging = Officially 155 kW (175 kW Actual) DC
11.3 or 19.2 kW AC (single 48-amp or dual 40-amp onboard charger) | designer = [[Linda Zhang]] (chief engineer){{cite web |url=https://time.com/6109417/linda-zhang-interview-cop26/|title=The Engineer Who Made Electric Vehicles Palatable for the Pickup-Truck Set|last= de la Garza |first = Alejandro |publisher=[[Time (magazine)|Time]] |date=2021-10-28 |accessdate=2022-07-28}}
Raleigh Haire, Josh Henry (exterior) }} The '''Ford F-150 Lightning''' is a [[Battery electric vehicle|battery electric]] full-size [[light duty truck]] unveiled by [[Ford Motor Company|Ford]] in May 2021 as part of the [[Ford F-Series (fourteenth generation)|fourteenth generation Ford F-Series]]. Four models have been announced, and all models initially will be dual-motor, four-wheel-drive, with [[Driving cycle|EPA range]] estimates of {{cvt|230–300|mi|km|round=10|abbr=out|lk=}}. The base price of the commercial-grade version [[all-wheel drive]] (AWD) truck in the United States was announced to be {{USD|39,974}}, with higher-power/trim/range models priced all the way up to {{USD|90,000}}. The F-150 Lightning began production on 26 April 2022.{{cite web |date=2022-04-27 |title=Ford Begins Production Of The F-150 Lightning At Historic Rouge Plant |url=https://www.carscoops.com/2022/04/ford-begins-production-of-the-f-150-lightning-at-historic-rouge-plant/ |access-date=2022-04-27 |website=Carscoops |language=en-US}} == History == [[File:2022_Ford_F-150_Lightning_Rear.jpg|thumb|Rear view|left]] In January 2019, Ford announced the intention to produce a [[battery electric vehicle|fully-electric]] light pickup at the 2019 [[Detroit Auto Show]].{{cite web|url=https://news.pickuptrucks.com/2019/05/08/index.html|title=PickupTrucks: News}} In July 2019, Ford tested prototype electric [[test mule]]s on existing F-150 chassis. This culminated in a record-setting demonstration test tow of {{convert|1250000|lb|kg}} on rails.{{cite news |url=https://insideevs.com/news/361332/video-ford-f150-electric-tows-million-pounds/ |title=Ford F-150 Electric Pickup Truck Tows 1 Million Pounds: Video |last=Ruffo|first=Gustavo Henrique |date=23 July 2019 |work=[[InsideEVs]] |access-date=13 June 2021 }} Chief engineer for the F-150, [[Linda Zhang]], emphasized at the time that Ford intended to take the "built Ford tough [characteristics of] durability, capability, and productivity and [extend that into] a whole new arena" of electric trucks. Ford unveiled the truck, and released the model name on 19 May 2021,{{cite news |title=From anti-Tesla design to huge frunk: 5 things to know about the electric Ford F-150 Lightning |url=https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/21/from-anti-tesla-design-to-huge-frunk-5-things-about-fords-f-150-lightning.html |last=Wayland|first=Michael |date=21 May 2021 |access-date=13 June 2021}} with production planned for spring of 2022.{{cite press release |url=https://media.ford.com/content/fordmedia/fna/us/en/news/2021/05/10/ford-to-reveal-all-electric-f-150-lightning.html |title=Ford to Reveal All-Electric F-150 Lightning May 19 with Livestreamed Event at Ford HQ |date=10 May 2021 |access-date=13 June 2021 |location=Dearborn, Michigan}} Ford received 69,500 refundable-deposit orders in the first four days after the announcement.{{cite web |url=https://www.msn.com/en-us/autos/news/2022-ford-f-150-lightning-electric-pickup-hits-70000-reservations/ar-AAKcxnZ |title=2022 Ford F-150 Lightning electric pickup hits 70,000 reservations |last=Szymkowski |first=Sean |date=26 May 2021 |website=msn.com |publisher=MSN Road Show |access-date=2021-06-01}} By late May 2021, Ford had begun discussing other electric trucks beyond the [[Ford F series|F-series]], such as the [[Ford Expedition electric|Expedition]] and [[Lincoln Navigator electric|Navigator]], which are intended to be underpinned by their full-size EV truck chassis, as well as a smaller chassis which will be used for the [[Ford Bronco#Sixth generation (U725; 2021)|Bronco]], [[Ford Explorer|Explorer]], and [[Lincoln Aviator|Aviator]].{{cite web |url=https://www.automobilemag.com/news/ford-ev-electric-explorer-aviator-ranger-bronco/ |title=Ford Has Bronco, Explorer, Ranger, Lincoln Aviator EVs in the Works |last1=Priddle|first1=Alisa |last2=Gillie |first2=Mark |publisher=Automobile Magazine |date=27 May 2021 |website=automobilemag.com |access-date=2021-06-01}} By June 11, 2021, over 100,000 reservations were made, and Ford announced that the company would offer digital services for subscription revenue that will change car sales from a single-time transaction process.{{cite news |title=Interest in Ford's electric pickup soars |url=https://www.arkansasonline.com/news/2021/jun/11/interest-in-fords-electric-pickup-soars/ |work=[[Arkansas Democrat-Gazette]] |date=11 June 2021 |access-date=13 June 2021 }} Ford had received more than 200,000 Lightning reservations for a 3-year backlog by the end of 2021.{{cite news |title=More than 120,000 Ford F-150 Lightning reservations on the books |url=https://www.msn.com/en-us/autos/news/more-than-120000-ford-f-150-lightning-reservations-on-the-books/ar-AAMIB0s |work=MSN Autos |date=29 July 2021 |access-date=30 July 2021 }}{{cite web|url=https://electrek.co/2021/12/07/ford-f-150-lightning-reservations-3-years-backlog/|title=Ford says it now has nearly 200,000 reservations for F-150 Lightning, or 3 years of backlog|date=7 December 2021}} The first pickup was manufactured on 18 April 2022, with first delivery on 26 May.[https://cleantechnica.com/2022/05/31/ford-f-150-lightning-reaches-its-first-customers/ Ford F-150 Lightning Reaches Its First Customers], CleanTechnica, Jo Borrás, May 31, 2022 In June 2022, Ford announced its intention to restructure its dealership model, including building an [[e-commerce]] platform where customers can buy [[Electric vehicle|EVs]] at non-negotiable prices in an effort to match [[Tesla, Inc.|Tesla]]’s profit margins.{{cite news|url=https://techcrunch.com/2022/06/02/ford-wants-to-sell-evs-online-only-and-at-a-set-price/|author=Jaclyn Trop|date=June 2, 2022|title=Ford wants to restructure its dealership model to boost EV sales|work=Tech Crunch}} Ford also stated that it would spend $3.7 billion to hire 6,200 union workers to staff several assembly plants in Michigan, Ohio and Missouri in a bid to sell 2 million EVs a year by 2026. Since launching in May 2021, the 2023 Base Lightning Pro model jumped in price from $41,669 to $48,769 (including a $1,795 destination fee) whereas the top Platinum grades increased $6,100 to $98,669. {{cite news|url=https://www.thecarconnection.com/news/1136775_2023-ford-f-150-lightning-price-increases-7-000-tops-out-near-100-000|author=Robert Duffer|date=August 9, 2022|title=2023 Ford F-150 Lightning price increases $7,000, tops out near $100,000|work=Car Connection}} == Description == The base configuration has {{cvt|452|HP}}, {{cvt|230|mi|km}} range, and its smaller battery supports a {{cvt|2000|lb|kg}} payload. The high-end configuration has {{cvt|580|HP}}, {{cvt|300|mi|km}} [[Driving cycle|EPA range]], {{convert|0-60|mph|km/h|abbr=on}} times in the mid-four-second range, and a towing capacity of {{cvt|10000|lb|kg}}. All models have {{cvt|775|lbft|Nm}} of torque, full-time 4wd, independent rear suspension, and will initially come in a crew-cab configuration only, with a {{cvt|5.5|ft|m}} bed. The active suspension provides real-time load weighing function. Like [[Tesla, Inc.|Tesla]], the Ford F-150 Lightning is announced to include over-the-air software updates, and a significant software driving aids which will allow limited hands-off highway driving, but fall short of full [[Self-driving car|self-driving]]. The F-150 Lightning in some trim packages, in concert with the "80[[Ampere|A]] Ford Charge Station pro with Ford Intelligent Backup Power capability," can provide household-oriented [[Vehicle-to-grid|V2G]] power, which can meet the electrical needs of a typical American home for three to ten days. The truck can also supply up to 9.6 kW of power through up to eleven 120V and 240V electrical outlets distributed around the truck.{{cite news |title=Ford F-150 Lightning Power Export Outlets And Home Backup Power |url=https://insideevs.com/news/508802/ford-f150-lightning-outlets-backup/ |last=Kane|first=Mark |date=21 May 2021 |work=[[InsideEVs]] |access-date=13 June 2021 }} This electric truck has a standard battery and can travel {{cvt|370|km|order=flip}} on a single charge. [[Driving cycle|EPA range]] estimates of {{cvt|230–300|mi|km|round=10|abbr=out|lk=}} produced by Ford in May 2021 were based on {{cvt|1000|lb|kg}} of cargo carried in the truck. [[Electrek]] reported that the range with no load, just a driver and the truck, appeared to be closer to {{cvt|400|mi|km}}.{{cite news |last=Lambert |first=Fred |date=28 May 2021 |title=Ford F-150 Lightning's 300-mile range is with 1,000 lbs of cargo, actual range could be over 400 miles |work=[[Electrek]] |url=https://electrek.co/2021/05/28/ford-f150-lightning-range-cargo/ |access-date=16 June 2021}} The Ford F-150 Lightning was also evaluated to reach {{cvt|100|km/h|order=flip}} in 4.5 seconds.{{cite web|last=Alice|first=Charlotte|date=2021-11-30|title=Don't Miss Out: All-New Update Ford F-150 Preview|url=https://fordtrend.com/ford-f-150/|access-date=2021-12-13|website=FordTrend|language=en-US}} Maximum available payload is {{convert|2,235|lb}}, which includes the {{convert|400|lb|adj=on}} payload of the front trunk (called a "frunk" by Ford). The new Lightning can tow up to {{convert|10,000|lb}}.{{cite web|last=Priddle|first=Alisa|date=2021-05-20|title=2022 Ford F-150 Lightning First Look: The Electric Pickup Has a Shockingly Low Price, Mega Specs|url=https://www.motortrend.com/news/2022-ford-f-150-lightning-electric-first-look-review/|access-date=2021-09-17|website=MotorTrend|language=en-US}} Starting price is {{USD|39,974}} for the "commercial-grade Lightning Pro" [[Fleet vehicle|fleet]] version while the "mid-series" XLT model starts at {{USD|52,974}}. Higher priced Lariat and Platinum models are priced up to {{USD|90,000}}.{{cite web |url=https://www.consumerreports.org/hybridsevs/2022-ford-f-150-lightning-review-a4084273266/ |title=Ford F-150 Lightning EV Has a 300-Mile Range and Could Power Your Home |last=Bartlett|first=Jeff S. |date=19 May 2021 |website=consumerreports.org |publisher=Consumer Reports |access-date=13 June 2021 }} In ''MotorTrend'' testing of an F-150 Lightning Platinum without a trailer and only the driver, the Platinum attained a range of {{convert|255|mi|km}}. When towing a {{convert|7,218|lb|kg|adj=on}}, {{cvt|33|ft|11|in}} camper, the F-150 Platinum was only able to reach {{convert|90|mi|km}}. The test was over a {{convert|80|mi|km|adj=on}} route with average highway speeds between {{cvt|64|and|67|mph|km/h}}, and with the headlights and audio system on and the automatic climate control set to {{convert|72|F|C}}.{{cite web |last1=Tingwall |first1=Eric |title=Tow No! The Ford F-150 Lightning Struggled in Our Towing Test |url=https://www.motortrend.com/reviews/ford-f150-lightning-electric-truck-towing-test/ |website=motortrend.com|publisher=MOTOR TREND GROUP, LLC |access-date=5 August 2022}} The F-150 Lightning is produced at the new [[Ford River Rouge Complex|Ford Rouge Electric Vehicle Center]] in Michigan, and involves two other plants: the Van Dyke Electric Powertrain Center in [[Sterling Heights, Michigan|Sterling Heights]], Michigan which will assemble the electric motors and the Rawsonville Components Plant in [[Ypsilanti, Michigan|Ypsilanti]], Michigan will produce the batteries.{{cite web|last=Segura|first=Elenor|date=2021-09-16|title=Ford Starts Pre-Production of the 2022 F-150 Lightning Electric Truck|url=https://www.motortrend.com/news/2022-ford-f-150-lightning-preproduction-factory-investment/|access-date=2021-09-17|website=MotorTrend|language=en-US}} === Trim levels === {{Unreferenced section|date=June 2022}} For the 2022 model year, the F-150 Lightning is available in four trim levels: Pro, XLT, Lariat, and Platinum. The Pro trim will only be available with the smaller-capacity battery, and the Platinum will only offer the higher-capacity battery, although all other trims will include the smaller-capacity battery as standard equipment, but will also offer the higher-capacity battery as an option. The base Pro trim is comparable to the XL trim of the regular [[Ford F-150|F-150]]. Standard equipment includes a vinyl-trimmed interior, vinyl flooring, a 12-inch [[Ford SYNC]] 4A touchscreen infotainment system, eighteen-inch on/off-road all-terrain tires and machined-face aluminum-alloy wheels, a keyless entry keypad on the front driver's door, and full power equipment. The mid-level XLT trim adds comfort and convenience features onto the base Pro trim, such as cloth seating surfaces, carpeted flooring with front and rear floor mats, a center [[LED]] light bar above the front "grille", and integrated side steps. The luxury-oriented Lariat trim adds luxury amenities onto the mid-level XLT trim, such as twenty-inch on/off-road all-terrain tires and machined-face aluminum-alloy wheels, perforated luxury leather-trimmed seating surfaces, a 15.5-inch tablet-style Ford SYNC 4A touchscreen infotainment system, a [[Bang and Olufsen]] eight-speaker audio system, dual heated and ventilated front bucket seats, a heated leather-wrapped steering wheel, and color-keyed exterior door handles and side mirror caps. The top-tier Platinum trim adds features onto the luxury-oriented Lariat trim, such as a higher-capacity battery, an upgraded front "grille", 22-inch all-season tires and machined-face aluminum-alloy wheels, the Tow Technology Package, the Max Trailer Tow Package, the Ford BlueCruise semi-autonomous driving system, "Nirvana" perforated luxury leather-trimmed seating surfaces, a twin-panel panoramic moonroof, and a Bang and Olufsen Unleashed eighteen-speaker amplified surround sound audio system. == See also == * [[GMC Hummer EV]] * [[Lordstown Endurance]] *[[Plug-in electric vehicles in the United States]] * [[Rivian R1T]] * [[Tesla Cybertruck]] * [[Chevrolet Silverado EV]] == External links == * [https://www.ford.com/trucks/f150/f150-lightning/2022/?gnav=header-electrified-vhp Ford F-150 Lightning, official website] == References == {{reflist}} {{Ford F-Series}} [[Category:Electric concept cars]] [[Category:Ford F-Series]] [[Category:Ford Motor Company]] [[Category:Pickup trucks]] [[Category:Electric trucks]]
